--- On Sat, 7/31/10, mlleja=
de <leongbabe@...> wrote:

From: mllejade <leongbabe@...>
Subject: =
[EVP-ITC] Re: Experiment 3
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, July=
 31, 2010, 12:22 PM







=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      Hi RJ,

=


Thought I'd give clairvoyance/clairaudience a try and as soon as I asked =
the question regarding what you've placed on top of your computer monitor, =
I immediately saw and heard: a "toy car."



Sharon from SF



--- In EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com, "rasterer" <rasterer@...> wrote:

>

> 

> This experim=
ent is intended for those interested in exploring the Remote Viewing capabi=
lities of their Ghost Box's, EVP recorders. or even personal clairvoyant or=
 precognitive capabilities  And to maybe even have a little fun here.

> 

=
> On Friday, 7/30/2010 I placed an object on top of my computer monitor, ri=
ght in front of me, and will leave it there until noon Denver time on Monda=
y, 8/2/2010.   This experiment asks for participants to determine what that=
 object is. Vague or partial answers won't be counted (for example, just gi=
ving a color, shape, size,  what it's made of, etc): we're looking for what=
 it is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Denver time Monday won't count.  =
Participants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other means t=
hey chose.  At the end of the experiment, I will reveal the object, and a t=
ally of the number of correct and/or incorrect answers.

> 

> In order to =
keep me honest, I have taken a picture of the object at the start of the ex=
periment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder) of this group.  The=
 idea with this file is that you can download it now and 'keep it safe' on =
your computer. Then at the end of the experiment, I will post the password =
so you can reveal the contents of the file. That way, you were in control o=
f the original image during the entire test, not me.  

> 

> Password pdf:=
 http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100730.pdf

> 

> =
And if you do not care to download the pdf file now, I will post the final =
image there at the end of the experiment anyway.

> 

> My monitor is one o=
f the older box-like SONY CRTs, and says "Trinitron" and  "Multiscan 200sf"=
 on the upper front.   I have a couple monitors stacked in my closet too: t=
hey are not the monitors used in this experiment (they are not plugged in, =
and have nothing else on them anyway), and I have several laptops around: t=
hey are also not the monitors in this experiment.  The monitor in this expe=
riment is the only SONY monitor I have, says "SONY in various places on it,=
 and can be seen in the following link from the first experiment, when the =
correct answer would have been "radio":

> 

> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com=
/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.JPG

> 

> Please post all answers to=
 the group thread: that way, there will be a public record and I won't get =
accused of losing any answers. Any answers sent directly to me, I will repo=
st on the public thread.

>





    
     

    
    


 



  






    =
